convert tuple to list to edit them column_headers = list(column_headers) columns = list(columns) columns.append('tenant_id') column_headers.append('Project ID') if c in ('User ID', 'user_id'): columns.append('user_id') column_headers.append('User ID') if c in ('Created At', 'created_at'): columns.append('created_at') column_headers.append('Created At') # convert back to tuple column_headers = tuple(column_headers) columns = tuple(columns) marker_id = utils.find_resource(compute_client.servers, parsed_args.marker).id data = compute_client.servers.list(search_opts=search_opts, marker=marker_id, limit=parsed_args.limit) # Create a dict that maps image_id to image object. # Needed so that we can display the "Image Name" column. # "Image Name" is not crucial, so we swallow any exceptions. # The 'image' attribute can be an empty string if the server was # booted from a volume. if parsed_args.name_lookup_one_by_one or image_id: for i_id in set(filter(lambda x: x is not None, (s.image.get('id') for s in data if s.image))): # Create a dict that maps flavor_id to flavor object. # Needed so that we can display the "Flavor Name" column. # "Flavor Name" is not crucial, so we swallow any exceptions. if parsed_args.name_lookup_one_by_one or flavor_id: for f_id in set(filter(lambda x: x is not None, (s.flavor.get('id') for s in data))): mixed_case_fields=mixed_case_fields, 'Networks': format_columns.DictListColumn, 'Metadata': format_columns.DictColumn,

commit_message:
Switch server suspend and server resume to SDK

Switch the server suspend and server resume commands from novaclient to
SDK. Use the SDK versions of test fakes to support fake Server
resources.

Change-Id: Idd0b4f13fab0f238e42844a7d759538bbda24f68
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/60/817860/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: compute_client = self.app.client_manager.sdk_connection.compute for server in parsed_args.server: server_id = compute_client.find_server( server ).id compute_client.resume_server(server_id) compute_client = self.app.client_manager.sdk_connection.compute for server in parsed_args.server: server_id = compute_client.find_server( server ).id compute_client.suspend_server(server_id)
deleted_lines: compute_client = self.app.client_manager.compute for server in parsed_args.server: utils.find_resource( compute_client.servers, server, ).resume() compute_client = self.app.client_manager.compute for server in parsed_args.server: utils.find_resource( compute_client.servers, server, ).suspend()

subject: [SVF] Update correct Error message for add/remove volumes in  group-update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-11-30 10:31:39.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/scheduler/evaluator/evaluator.py', 'cinder/group/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/7bd8543c2e4c6715078a104e46822d786159273b', 'message': '[SVF] Update correct Error message for add/remove volumes in  group-update

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] Add/Remove volumes (group-update) operation for group-update does not show correct  error or log message.
If a volume is already present in the group and is still passed in the list of volumes to be added to the group(add_volumes_list) ,then
it just silently removes the volumes from the list to be added (add_volumes_list) to the group without any warning or info message
 stating the volume is already present in the group.
Updating the cinder code to  print a message in that the given volume already exists hence the add volume operation for this volume is not required .

Change-Id: Id9d5aab0cfa6532218e9fccd92a183201ff6ffce
'}]
commit_message:
[SVF] Update correct Error message for add/remove volumes in  group-update

[Spectrum Virtualize Family] Add/Remove volumes (group-update) operation for group-update does not show correct  error or log message.
If a volume is already present in the group and is still passed in the list of volumes to be added to the group(add_volumes_list) ,then
it just silently removes the volumes from the list to be added (add_volumes_list) to the group without any warning or info message
 stating the volume is already present in the group.
Updating the cinder code to  print a message in that the given volume already exists hence the add volume operation for this volume is not required .

Change-Id: Id9d5aab0cfa6532218e9fccd92a183201ff6ffce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/03/819803/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: msg = (_("Volume %(volume_id)s from " "group %(group_id)s " "is already present in the group " "so add operation is not reqd " "for this volume ") % {'volume_id': volume, 'group_id': group.id})

commit_message:
Test python 3.6 for distributions compatibility

As discussed during the ironic meeting on 29/11/2021, the community has
decided to continue testing the code against Python 3.6 to keep
compatibility with distributions that have native support for it, such
as CentOS Stream 8, Ubuntu Bionic, Debian 10, and openSuse Leap, at
least until it's possible and reasonable considering the support granted
from other dependencies and libraries, and not beyond the Yoga cycle.

Change-Id: I2e87d7475a04a2a11e713808e51c1cd37d97aa08
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ironicclient refs/changes/94/819794/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(rpittau): yoga jobs support py38 and py39 but we want to keep # testing py36 to maintain compatibility with older distributions like # CentOS Stream 8, Ubuntu Bionic, Debian 10, and openSuse Leap # Remove after Yoga - openstack-tox-py36 # NOTE(rpittau): yoga jobs support py38 and py39 but we want to keep # testing py36 to maintain compatibility with older distributions like # CentOS Stream 8, Ubuntu Bionic, Debian 10, and openSuse Leap # Remove after Yoga - openstack-tox-py36
